node.title: Air NZ restructures its support package with government
node.description: Air New Zealand has restructured its support package with the government, providing it with an additional cash buffer as it manages ongoing Covid disruptions.

node.title: Omicron uncertainty may put international travel plans at risk
node.description: It will still be "flyer beware" for people hoping to travel overseas from January as the border begins reopening, the Covid-19 Response Minister says.

node.title: Jane Campion's film leads nominations at Golden Globe Awards
node.description: New Zealand film director Jane Campion's western The Power of the Dog and Sir Kenneth Branagh's autobiographical film Belfast are up for seven prizes each.

node.title: Basketball Australia called out for 'clear racial discrimination'
node.description: An apologetic Basketball Australia has been caught out by an outdated rule that has been branded as "clear racial discrimination" by Melbourne Boomer Tiffany Mitchell.

node.title: Carl Williams' prison killer Matthew Johnson seeks to overturn murder conviction
node.description: The man jailed for life in 2011 for killing underworld figure Carl Williams in a Victorian prison has filed an appeal against his murder conviction.

node.title: What will travelling out of WA look like after the border comes down?
node.description: What you need to know about travelling out of WA when the hard border finally falls on February 5, from testing to vaccination to insurance.

node.title: Experts attest to Madeley mum's mental impairment when she killed young daughters
node.description: Both the defence and the prosecution in Perth mother Milka Djurasovic's trial agree she should not be found guilty of murdering her young girls Tiana and Mia, because she was not of sound mind at the time.

node.title: Appeals court upholds revival of "Remain in Mexico" border policy
node.description: The Biden administration restarted the Trump-era border program last week to comply with a federal court ruling.

node.title: Boris Johnson’s Charm Is Wearing Extremely Thin
node.description: Britons don’t know whether the prime minister can save himself, let alone Christmas.

node.title: Travelling 600km for a COVID test 'completely unviable', fed-up mum says
node.description: Outback residents say it's absurd that COVID testing is not available anywhere near the SA-NT border, particularly amid a scare at the nearby APY Lands.

node.title: Immigration court ruling 'life-saving', but NGO frustrated with slow processing of Afghans
node.description: Community Law says it is 'blown away' by the wide-ranging effects of its win in a High Court immigration case.

node.title: New Caledonia's indepedence vote a hollow victory that will ratchet up tensions
node.description: Analysis - New Caledonia had a contentious independence referendum, marred by low voter turn out. Pacific expert [David Robie examines the result.

node.title: Structural engineers want stronger penalties for errors within industry
node.description: Structural engineers want the fines for substandard designing boosted, warning that poor buildings are still slipping through.

node.title: It's not Squid Game but 10 people are pitted against each other for cash … and they're teachers
node.description: Footage of a "Dash for Cash" promotion, held during a hockey game in the US state of South Dakota, has prompted online outrage and sparked a national debate about school funding.

node.title: Your Tuesday Briefing
node.description: Two years of pandemic despair.

node.title: 'Like a turducken of bin fires': Best political cartoons of 2021 highlight the absurdities of the year that was
node.description: In a year where statistical models and predictions were at the forefront of all Australians minds, the Behind the Lines exhibition has set out to showcase all the other — unexpected — things that 2021 had to offer.

node.title: Lockdowns favoured professionals and managers, while low-income casuals hit hardest
node.description: With New South Wales, Victoria and the Australian Capital Territory in lockdown during August, new figures show nearly half the nation literally took their work home with them.

node.title: 'Failure to attempt to justify' voting age limit - Court of Appeal
node.description: Despite agreeing with Make It 16's argument, the court rejected an application to issue a declaration on the "intensely and quintessentially" political issue.

node.title: Tairāwhiti community leaders call for Covid-19 checkpoints over summer
node.description: Local leaders in the Tairāwhiti Gisborne region are calling for checkpoints around the region to protect its residents from Covid-19 this summer. Audio

node.title: Biden Speaks With Finland's President About Allaying Tension at Ukrainian Border
node.description: The pair "discussed their shared concerns about Russia's destabilizing military buildup," according to a readout.

node.title: 'A campaign of denial' - NZ Police and emergency housing
node.description: The police have been actively gathering and analysing detailed information on rising rates of crime and violence at emergency housing, despite insisting for months they do not "specifically" collect…

node.title: Surge in Americans skipping medical care due to cost
node.description: Almost 13 million people say they know a friend or family member who has died because they couldn't afford care.

node.title: Eddie Obeid's bid to get out of jail in time for Christmas
node.description: Lawyers for Eddie Obeid and Ian Macdonald say the former NSW Labor ministers should be released on home detention ahead of an appeal against their conspiracy convictions.

node.title: Two healthcare workers who visited aged care homes in Adelaide test positive to COVID-19
node.description: Two healthcare workers who provided care at a number of residential aged care facilities in Adelaide test positive to COVID-19. Authorities are contacting impacted sites.

node.title: Joshua Bellamy, Ex-Jet, Is Sentenced to 3 Years in Covid-19 Aid Scheme
node.description: Mr. Bellamy obtained a Paycheck Protection Program loan for $1.2 million for his company, Drip Entertainment L.L.C., by using false information, federal prosecutors said.

node.title: MGM Selling Mirage Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas to the Hard Rock for More Than $1b
node.description: The move marked the "culmination of a series of transformational transactions for MGM Resorts during the last several years," said MGM's chairman.

node.title: NBL ramps up investigation into ugly Melbourne derby melee
node.description: The fallout from Sunday's brawl between Melbourne United and South East Melbourne Phoenix continues, with five players and a coach facing the scrutiny of the NBL's game review panel.

node.title: TGA issues warning about counterfeit ivermectin
node.description: The national medical regulator warns people not to try and import ivermectin products, while also repeating warnings against using it to prevent or treat COVID-19.

node.title: 'Cutting-edge' project to extract water from air in the outback. But is it safe?
node.description: A small town in the Territory outback will play host to a new technology that sucks water from the atmosphere to create hydrogen – and the government is backing it with action.

node.title: Senate Passes Bill Allowing Capitol Police to Request Assistance Without Prior Approval
node.description: It took over an hour for the Pentagon to approve deploying the National Guard to the Capitol as tens of thousands of Trump supporters overwhelmed 1,200 Capitol Police officers.
